tutorial.title: Dynamic Reviews
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to use React to create a testimonials page that generates content dynamically

executableContent.instructions:
Let's explore reusable React components! In this project, you'll create a React component to display customer testimonials for a local restaurant. By feeding and displaying data dynamically via `props`, we'll be able to re-use the component to display as many testimonials as we want.

First, let's explore the provided code: the typical React structure, a `Testimonial` functional component definition, and a call to React's `render()` function. Since we'll want to display multiple components, we'll already gathered a few inside of an `App` component.

We'll start by adding an enclosing `<div>` element to the Testimonial component. When finished, you should see two `Testimonial` cards appear.  

1. Add a `<div>` element with CSS class `card` to the `Testimonial` functional component's `return` statement.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Testimonials

loading...

files.name: index.jsx
App.css

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's add some elements to the `Testimonial` component. We'll start with the title. When finished, you should see titles appear on both `Testimonial` cards. 

1. First, store the `title` prop in a `const` named `title`. 
2. Next, within the `<div>` element inside of `return()`, add an `<h2>` element containing the `title` constant.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Testimonials

loading...

files.name: index.jsx
App.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's now incorporate the `Testimonial` component''s author, following a similar process as the card's title.

1. Store the `author` prop in a constant named `author`.
2. Next, add an `<h5>` element containing the `author` immediately following the title. The text format should be similar to:
```javascript
Submitted by Tom J.
```

files.content:
Testimonials

loading...

files.name: index.jsx

executableContent.instructions:
We should also display the review's date. Let's include it in the same `<h5>` element as the author.

1. Store the `date` props in a constant named `date`.
2. Next, add the `date` immediately following the author. The text format should be similar to:
```javascript
Submitted by Tom J. on 10/20/2020
```

executableContent.instructions:
A `Testimonial` should also display the writer's 5-star rating, which, if you examine the provided code, is passed as an integer. 

1. Store the `stars` prop in a `const` and integrate it into the HTML structure in an `<h5>` tag. The text format should be similar to: 
```javascript
5 / 5 Stars
```

Finally, the `Testimonial` should display the actual testimonial review content in a `

` tag. 1. Store the `content` prop in a `const`. Then, integrate the `content` prop as a `

` element.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add another card to our website. 

1. Add another `Testimonial` element underneath the second `Testimonial` in the `App` component.
2. Next, pass the `author` and `date` props in the `Testimonial` element. You may choose any values you want -- make this your own Testimonial!
3. Finally, pass the 'stars' and 'content' props in the `Testimonial` element.  You may choose any values you want.
4. You should see a third `Testimonial` with the data you added!

executableContent.instructions: Nice work! In this project, you built a reusable Functional component. You then re-used them and added the necessary props to create a Testimonials page for a local restaurant! This is your opportunity to tinker with the code -- you can add additional fields to the Testimonial cards or create entirely new Testimonial cards. Try it out and see what you can create!
